channel.title: Searching a String array for a specified String?
channel.description: How would you do it? Like: [code] public String a[] = {"a", "b", "c" }; [/code] And then checking if it contains a.

item.title: Searching a String array for a specified String?
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:4, topic:123907”]for(String s : a) if(s.equals("yourstring")) System.out.println("found");

However you would know this if you took any time to actually learn the language, please read all of the Sun Java Tutorial to get a great start, I guarantee that you won’t regret it.[/quote][quote=“Protosstribe, post:1, topic:124388”]Here is another one, with a method and all. It is pretty much the same as Moparisthebest’s though, but maybe easier to see?

[code]public boolean contains(String[] array, String string) {
for(String s : array) {
if(s.equalsIgnoreCase(string)) {
return true;
break;
}
}

 return false;

}[/code][/quote]

Sorry for bothering you guys with my questions.
I learned how to by myself though, but thank you.

String[] theStrings = new String[] {"hai", "gais", "i", "r", "vary", "sary", "lel"}; for (int i = 0; i < theStrings.length; i++) { if (Strings[i].equals("hai")) { System.out.println("I found hai at " + i); } }

item.title: Searching a String array for a specified String?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

return true; break; }
Lmao.

break; is an unreachable statement.

item.title: Searching a String array for a specified String?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

for(String s : a) if(s.equals("yourstring")) System.out.println("found");

However you would know this if you took any time to actually learn the language, please read all of the Sun Java Tutorial to get a great start, I guarantee that you won’t regret it.
